spacegame.client
Class DebuggerClient

java.lang.Object
  spacegame.client.DebuggerClient

public class DebuggerClient
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a launcher for a basic, command line, client that can be used to debug the server and protocol errors. It takes command line input from a user and sends it directly to the server. Messages received from the server are displayed on the command line for the user to see. This debugger client uses the BasicProtocol implementation of AbtractProtocol. This class along with the BasicProtocol class is an example of how to use this basic networking code of the package 'spacegame.client' to write your own client protocols to interact with a server of similar or direct implementation of 'spacegame.server'

Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
This is the main method that launches the basic DebuggerClient. It creates a Client and a BasicProtocol, along with the Threads to run them.

Parameters:
args - the arguments given to java.exe on the command line (ignored)

                                     AbstractProtocol protocol)
                              throws java.io.IOException
This method loops to take command line input from a user and send it to the server

Parameters:

client - a spacegame.client.Client object that interfaces with the server
